TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.FORM: uzai a maḍusa a marekaka ka sitsuayan.
ozai a madrosa a marekaka ka sicoayan.
S.TRANSL: Once upon a time there were two brothers.

S.FORM: kiłavaran a kaka tjałałak: "uzai a djarałap i katsasavan ku liłing.
kiljavaran a kaka tjaljaljak: "ozai a djaraljap i kacasavan ko liljing.
S.TRANSL: The younger brother said: “There is a banyan tree in the courtyard that I shelter under.

S.FORM: nu tja leglegen, matjani a vałitjuq kasi vavaw tua djarałap, kaka," ayain a tjavulung.
no tja leglegen, matjani a valjitjoq kasi vavaw toa djaraljap, kaka," ayain a tjavolong.
S.TRANSL: When we shake it, money falls down from on top of the banyan, brother,” he said to the older one.

S.FORM: qau "nu maitazua vaik anga ken kiliłing, sa ku leglegi anga, uła ken a puvałitjuq," aya a kaka a tjavulung.
qao "no maitazoa vaik anga ken kililjing, sa ko leglegi anga, olja ken a povaljitjoq," aya a kaka a tjavolong.
S.TRANSL: “In that case I’ll go and shelter under it and shake it, so that I can get some money,” said the older brother.

S.FORM: qau inika tsuatsuay vaik azua kaka a tjavulung a kiliłing, sa leglegi.
qao inika coacoay vaik azoa kaka a tjavolong a kililjing, sa leglegi.
S.TRANSL: Not long afterwards the older brother went and sheltered under it and shook it.

S.FORM: manu matjani a marka qatjuvi marka qatjulał marka qatsiłay.
mano matjani a marka qatjovi marka qatjolalj marka qaciljay.
S.TRANSL: But snakes, worms and stones fell down.

S.FORM: qau limutseng azua kaka a tjavulung.
qao limoceng azoa kaka a tjavolong.
S.TRANSL: The older brother was angry,

S.FORM: muri seqasen a kaka a tjałałak.
mori seqasen a kaka a tjaljaljak.
S.TRANSL: and was going to knife his younger brother.

S.FORM: qau kiłavaran a kaka a tjałałak: "nu ini su kasalu, tiakenay a lemegleg."
qao kiljavaran a kaka a tjaljaljak: "no ini so kasalo, tiakenay a lemegleg."
S.TRANSL: The younger brother said: “If you don’t believe me, I’ll do the shaking.”

S.FORM: qau leglegen nimadju.
qao leglegen nimadjo.
S.TRANSL: He shook it;

S.FORM: mintu matjani a vałitjuq marka situngan.
minto matjani a valjitjoq marka sitongan.
S.TRANSL: and down fell money and clothes.

S.FORM: qau masalu anga a kaka a tjavulung.
qao masalo anga a kaka a tjavolong.
S.TRANSL: So the older brother believed him.

S.FORM: kiłavaran anan uta azua kaka a tjałałak: "uzai a niaken a titaw a bulabulay.
kiljavaran anan ota azoa kaka a tjaljaljak: "ozai a niaken a titaw a bolabolay.
S.TRANSL: The younger brother also said: “I’ve got a fine hoe.

S.FORM: nu tja sikali tua qipu, łekatsauan a sauzayan," ayain a kaka tjavulung.
no tja sikali toa qipo, ljekacaoan a saozayan," ayain a kaka tjavolong.
S.TRANSL: If we dig the soil with it, treasure appears,” he said to his older brother.

S.FORM: kiłavaran a kaka a tjavulung: "nu maitazua pasedjami aken tua nisun a titaw," aya a kaka a tjavulung.
kiljavaran a kaka a tjavolong: "no maitazoa pasedjami aken toa nison a titaw," aya a kaka a tjavolong.
S.TRANSL: The older brother said: “In that case lend me your hoe,” said the older brother.

S.FORM: qau pasedjaman, sa titavan nua kaka a tjavulung tua qipu.
qao pasedjaman, sa titavan noa kaka a tjavolong toa qipo.
S.TRANSL: So he lent it and the older one hoed the soil with it.

S.FORM: łakua nu temitaw, qatsiłai katua kasiw sakamaya.
ljakoa no temitaw, qaciljai katoa kasiw sakamaya.
S.TRANSL: But when he hoed there were only stones and wood.

S.FORM: qau limutseng azua kaka; siverits azua titaw.
qao limoceng azoa kaka; siveric azoa titaw.
S.TRANSL: So that brother was angry and threw away the hoe.

S.FORM: qau limutseng azua kaka a tjałałak uta.
qao limoceng azoa kaka a tjaljaljak ota.
S.TRANSL: So the younger brother was angry too.

S.FORM: ini anga pare qaqivuivu tiamadju.
ini anga pare qaqivoivo tiamadjo.
S.TRANSL: They wouldn’t speak to one another.

S.FORM: uzai a qadaw malap azua kaka a tjałałak tua łaugiu, sa kani.
ozai a qadaw malap azoa kaka a tjaljaljak toa ljaogio, sa kani.
S.TRANSL: One day the younger brother took some shallots and ate them,

S.FORM: sa vaik a sema tjua mamazangiłan, sa qetjutj.
sa vaik a sema tjoa mamazangiljan, sa qetjotj.
S.TRANSL: and went to the chief’s place, and broke wind.

S.FORM: manu semqu azua mamazangiłan; manu paka ngułinguł aravats a mamazangiłan.
mano semqo azoa mamazangiljan; mano paka ngoljingolj aravac a mamazangiljan.
S.TRANSL: The chief smelled it and thought it very fragrant.

S.FORM: qau pavayan tua vałitjuq marka lami.
qao pavayan toa valjitjoq marka lami.
S.TRANSL: And he gave him money and staple foods.

S.FORM: manu lemangda a kaka a tjavulung tu nakeman tua łaugiu sa qetjutj; qau kipavayan anga timadju tua vałitjuq, aya linangdan.
mano lemangda a kaka a tjavolong to nakeman toa ljaogio sa qetjotj; qao kipavayan anga timadjo toa valjitjoq, aya linangdan.
S.TRANSL: The older brother heard that he had eaten shallots and broken wind, and had been given money, according to what he heard.

S.FORM: "nangaq a vaik aken a tsemakaw tua łaugiu, sa ku kani; sa ku vaik a qemtjutj tua mamazangiłan.
"nangaq a vaik aken a cemakaw toa ljaogio, sa ko kani; sa ko vaik a qemtjotj toa mamazangiljan.
S.TRANSL: “I must go and steal some shallots and eat them and go and break wind to the chief,

S.FORM: ki ken a pavayi anga tua vałitjuq nua mamazangiłan," aya timadju.
ki ken a pavayi anga toa valjitjoq noa mamazangiljan," aya timadjo.
S.TRANSL: and the chief will give me some money,” he said.

S.FORM: qau vaik a tsemakaw tua łaugiu sa kani, sa vaik a qemtjutj tua mamazangiłan.
qao vaik a cemakaw toa ljaogio sa kani, sa vaik a qemtjotj toa mamazangiljan.
S.TRANSL: So he went and stole some shallots and ate them, and went and broke wind to the chief.

S.FORM: manu qangsel aravats.
mano qangsel aravac.
S.TRANSL: It made a dreadful stink.

S.FORM: qau limutseng a mamazangiłan.
qao limoceng a mamazangiljan.
S.TRANSL: The chief was angry,

S.FORM: seqasen anga azua kaka a tjavulung.
seqasen anga azoa kaka a tjavolong.
S.TRANSL: and the older brother was cut down (and killed).
